critique: This executive order focuses on coordinating the implementation and enforcement of existing nondiscrimination laws. It delegates authority to the Attorney General to ensure consistent application of these laws across federal programs. It does not create new protected classes or expand the scope of existing laws, but rather aims to streamline their enforcement. It also does not touch on immigration or national security. The order centralizes authority in the Attorney General's office, indicating a move towards federal control. Given its focus on enforcing civil rights laws, it leans slightly liberal. It does not directly address economic regulation. It promotes social inclusion by ensuring nondiscrimination in federally funded programs.
